alert.note: Alert for Litchfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 09 at 2:14PM EDT until April 10 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Housatonic River At Gaylordsville. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Flood stage. Water reaches New Milford Foundry and Youngfield Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 7.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 8.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.2 feet on 12/19/2000. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Housatonic River Gaylordsville Flood Stage: 8.0 Observed Stage at Sat 2 pm: 7.6 Forecast: Sat 8 pm 8.0 Sun 2 am 8.1 Sun 8 am 8.1 Sun 2 pm 8.0 Sun 8 pm 7.9 Mon 2 am 7.7 Mon 8 am 7.5 Mon 2 pm 7.3 Mon 8 pm 7.1 Tue 2 am 7.0 Tue 8 am 6.8 &&
